meanings.sent1: She decided to exteriorise her feelings by painting a bright mural on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The architect wanted to exteriorise the beauty of the building through unique designs.
meanings.sent3: The artist's attempt to exteriorise the chaos of her mind resulted in a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His smile exteriorised the joy he felt inside, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The flowers exteriorised their vibrant colors, brightening the garden.

meanings.sent1: He tried to exteriorise his gratitude by writing a heartfelt thank-you note.
meanings.sent2: The actress knew how to exteriorise a range of emotions on stage.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to exteriorise his surprise at the trick made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes exteriorised the sadness she was trying to hide, betraying her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The music exteriorised the passion of the composer, moving the listeners to tears.
